data.title: Live On - Michigan State University
data.text:
North Neighborhood halls are the oldest residence halls on campus and feature traditional collegiate-style architecture. North combines what were formerly known as Red Cedar and West Circle, stretching just north of the Red Cedar River and alongside Michigan and Grand River avenues on what was MSU's original campus.

North Neighborhood is located near the MSU Union, Adams Field, the Broad Art Museum and Grand River Avenue. A schedule for the weekly fitness classes available in this neighborhood can be found here.

See Photo Gallery >

All residence halls in Brody Neighborhood feature community-style bathrooms, and all halls are co-ed by wing. The halls also feature the largest student rooms on campus and parking just outside of the buildings. Brody is located close to the Spartan athletic facilities and the Breslin Student Events Center. Fitness centers are located in Armstrong, Bailey, Bryan, Butterfield and Rather halls. A schedule for the weekly fitness classes available in this neighborhood can be found here.

See Photo Gallery >

At MSU, we offer apartment living that provides students with the convenience of campus along with the comforts of home. 1855 Place and University Village are university-operated apartment complexes that give residents a safe living environment, close proximity to campus and fully furnished spaces. These apartments are the perfect fit for students looking for an off-campus experience but who love the benefits of on-campus living. 1855 Place also provides family housing for students looking for a home for their loved ones while attending school at MSU. Enjoy these maintenance-free apartment living options while remaining within the bustling MSU community. A weekly schedule for fitness classes offered for residents of the apartments can be found here.

See Photo Gallery >

River Trail Neighborhood is located along the south bank of the Red Cedar River on Shaw Lane. River Trail Neighborhood includes McDonel Hall, Shaw Hall, Owen Graduate Hall and Van Hoosen Apartments.

Nearby you will find the Business College Complex, the MSU College of Law, the College of Veterinary Medicine, IM East and the Wharton Center for Performing Arts. The cardio fitness center for River Trail is located in Shaw Hall, and exercise classes are held in McDonel Hall. A schedule for the weekly fitness classes available in this neighborhood can be found here.

See Photo Gallery >

East Neighborhood is located on the northeast side of campus near the intersection of Hagadorn and Shaw roads. East Neighborhood has an edgy and eclectic vibe.

Nearby, you will find IM East, the Wharton Center for Performing Arts and the Business College Complex. A schedule for the weekly fitness classes available in this neighborhood can be found here.

See Photo Gallery >

South Neighborhood is located southwest of Spartan Stadium between West Shaw Lane and Trowbridge Road. It is near the Breslin Center, Munn Ice Arena, IM Sports West and outdoor tennis facilities.

South Neighborhood is made up of four residence halls (Case, Wonders, Holden and Wilson halls), which all feature co-ed floors and suite-style rooms. A schedule for the weekly fitness classes available in this neighborhood can be found here.

See Photo Gallery >
